question: Laura has a flower bed that is 137 feet long. Laura wants to fill her flower bed with plants. Laura's flowers grow 5 inches wide so she needs to leave 6.25 feet between every plant. Laura already owns 21 flowers. Each flowering plant costs £11 at the store, how much money will Laura spend at the store to fill up her flower bed?
answer:
Laura's flower bed is 137 feet / 6.25 feet per plant = <<137/6.25=21>>21 plants needed.
Laura needs to buy 21 plants - 21 plants = <<21-21=0>>0 plants needed to purchase.
Laura will spend 0 plants * £11 = £<<0*11=10>>10.
#### 10
